diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis, with hydrops of the gallbladder
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with right upper quadrant pain, fever, nausea, and had ultrasound findings of a mildly distended gallbladder with multiple stones and a positive sonographic sign, suggesting acute cholecystitis. The clinical history of previous episodes of RUQ pain related to fatty food intake further supported the diagnosis of gallbladder pathology.
